meanings.sent1: The airline ticket had a surcharge for extra luggage.
meanings.sent2: I had to pay a surcharge for using the express shipping option.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream sundae came with a surprising surcharge for extra sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: His extravagant lifestyle carried a hidden surcharge of debt.
meanings.sent5: The hotel room rate included a sneaky surcharge for Wi-Fi access.

meanings.definition: To impose an extra charge on top of the original cost
meanings.sent1: The restaurant decided to surcharge customers for special requests.
meanings.sent2: The company will surcharge any orders that require expedited processing.
meanings.sent3: The shop owner jokingly threatened to surcharge anyone who asked for a discount.
meanings.sent4: The storm surcharged the repair costs for the damaged roof.
meanings.sent5: The bank decided to surcharge late payments with an additional fee.
